title: All Drinks
text:
drinks <- read.csv("all_drinks.csv")


library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(drinks, aes(x = strCategory)) +
  geom_bar() +
  labs(
    x = "Drink Category",
    y = "Count",
    title = "Analysis of amount of drinks in each drink category",
  ) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))








Here is my data viz for food consumption!
Link to data set: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2020/2020-02-18/food_consumption.csv

title: Food Consumption
text:
food <- read.csv("food_consumption.csv")

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(food, aes(x = co2_emmission, y = consumption)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(
    x = "CO2 Emissions",
    y = "Consumption",
    title = "Relationship food consumption and CO2 emissions",
  )








Here is my data viz for food consumption! link to data set: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2020/2020-05-26/all_drinks.csv
